DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Procedure No Clean Cloth Average Use Days Per Week Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The average number of days per week that a cleaning cloth, a fabric used to wipe away dirt or contamination, as a defined procedure of a clinical study, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people, was not used.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Procedure No Clean Cloth Average Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the average non-use of a cleaning cloth, a fabric used to wipe away dirt or contamination, as a defined procedure of a clinical study, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Any stepwise set of actions.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:The action of removing dirt, filth, or unwanted substances from.:Material formed by weaving, knitting, felting, or pressing fibers together.:A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The action of removing dirt, filth, or unwanted substances from.
Material formed by weaving, knitting, felting, or pressing fibers together.
A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Information related to the determination of the number of days in a period of seven consecutive days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.       :For each, generally denoting a ratio.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
Determining the number or amount of something.
